intro: Chaerophyllum guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a short stem with a cluster of small, white to greenish flowers at the top. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
